 ]
with open(os.path.expanduser("~/.pam_environment"), "a", encoding="utf-8") as f1:
 f1.write("\n" + "\n".join([
 var.partition("=")[0] + " DEFAULT=" +
 var.partition("=")[2] for var in vars]))
with open(os.path.expanduser("~/.bash_profile"), "a", encoding="utf-8") as f2:

with open(os.path.expanduser("~/.profile"), "a", encoding="utf-8") as f2:

with open(os.path.expanduser("~/.bashrc"), "a", encoding="utf-8") as f2:

 f2.write("\n" + "\nexport ".join(vars) + "\n")

fc7fb8cca5feb89c58a5dba06cf102af:
RUN echo 'cat << EOF

This Docker provides preconfigured environment for running the command
line REST client for $(tput setaf 6)Swagger Petstore$(tput sgr0).

For convenience, you can export the following environment variables:

$(tput setaf 3)PETSTORE_HOST$(tput sgr0) - server URL, e.g. https://example.com:8080
$(tput setaf 3)PETSTORE_API_KEY$(tput sgr0) - access token, e.g. "ASDASHJDG63456asdASSD"
$(tput setaf 3)PETSTORE_API_KEY$(tput sgr0) - access token, e.g. "ASDASHJDG63456asdASSD"
$(tput setaf 3)PETSTORE_BASIC_AUTH$(tput sgr0) - basic authentication credentials, e.g.: "username:password"

$(tput setaf 7)Basic usage:$(tput sgr0)

$(tput setaf 3)Print the list of operations available on the service$(tput sgr0)
$ petstore-cli -h

$(tput setaf 3)Print the service description$(tput sgr0)
$ petstore-cli --about

$(tput setaf 3)Print detailed information about specific operation$(tput sgr0)
$ petstore-cli <operationId> -h

By default you are logged into Zsh with full autocompletion for your REST API,
but you can switch to Bash, where basic autocompletion is also supported.

EOF
' | tee -a ~/.bashrc ~/.zshrc
